result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camil T Maroun

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Camil T Maroun in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Camil T Maroun.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on defendant's motions regarding bind over and deficiency in complaint.
3:31 p.m. - Record/argument by Atty. Herrmann in response to Defendant's brief and asks the Court to deny the motion.
3:35 p.m. Court addresses Atty. LaVoy as to procedure before he allows him to argue as to the merits.
3:35 p.m. - Response/record/argument by Atty. LaVoy.
3:42 p.m. - Response by the Court. Court addresses the State as to consent issue raised by the defense. Response to Court's questions by ADA Herrmann.
3:45 p.m. - Response/final argument/request to argue probable cause as to burglary charge. Response/further argument by Atty. Herrmann.
3:46 p.m. - Response/record by the Court who based upon the record agrees with the State and denies the motion as to burglary charge.
Discussion as to further scheduling, discovery, future motions.
Court goes off the record for scheduling.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Reply to State's Response to Motion to Dismiss
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss and Motion to Review Bindover
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss and Motion to Review Bindover
Transcript of preliminary hearing held on April 11, 2022
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.
Defendant in court with attorney Jonathan LaVoy. ADA TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. Needs to be re-assigned. Attorney will filing a motion after assigned. Minutes filed.
Sent audio to Court Reporter to transcribe transcript request.

Prior: 170 N Hyer La,8, Whitewater, WI 53190

for Transcript of Preliminary Hearing held on April 11, 2022. $10.00 request fee paid.
06/08/2022 - Sent audio to court reporter/ms
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Camil T Maroun in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Camil T Maroun. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:08 PM (64-06)  Defendant Camil T Maroun in court.  Attorney Daniel C. Nedset in court for Camil T Maroun.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness  Detective Jacob Hintz.
Jacob Hintz duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann.
Witness identified the defendant in Court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
3:10 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Nedset.
3:26 PM - Re-direct by ADA Herrmann.
Evidence is closed.
3:27 PM - Argument by the State.
3:27 PM - Argument by Attorney Nedset,
 Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him/her over to stand trial on the charges. requests dismissal.
ADA Herrmann is requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing. Attorney Nedset requests an earlier date.
